content.question: Students are experimenting with a converging lens that has a <math alttext="30 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></math> focal length. They place an object on the principal axis of the lens and record both the distance <math alttext="s sub o" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>s</mi><mi>o</mi></msub></math> between the lens and the object and the distance <math alttext="s sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>s</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> between the lens and the image that is formed. When they make a plot of <math alttext="the fraction 1 over s sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>s</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="the fraction 1 over s sub o" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>s</mi><mi>o</mi></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>, the resulting graph is a straight line with a slope of <math alttext="m sub 30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>30</mn></msub></math>. Next, they repeat the process with a <math alttext="90 centimeter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>cm</mtext></math> focal length converging lens. This time, the resulting graph has a slope of <math alttext="m sub 90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>90</mn></msub></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="m sub 30, to m sub 90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>30</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>90</mn></msub></mstyle></math> of the two slopes?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
